title: Getting Started
description: beehiiv is the newsletter platform built for growth.
content:
Harness beehiiv's API to enrich your user records with custom fields from external forms,
manage lists and segmentation programmatically, and integrate your beehiiv publication
more closely with advertising platforms.










Looking for support? Inspiration? Check out our other resources:
Knowledge Base: Product support, documentation, and assistance.

Tutorials: Archive of video tutorials.

Course: How to build, scale, and monetize your newsletter.

Blog: Best practices to help scale your newsletter.

Submit a support ticket

title: Create an API Key
description: Get up and running with the beehiiv API.
content:
The beehiiv API key is used as the Bearer Token for all requests.
It enables secure account authentication and should be kept secret at all times.


Log in to beehiiv.
Navigate to the Integrations page
Click on Settings and then Integrations
Click the New API Key button
After creating your API key, be sure to copy and safely save the key, as it
will be inaccessible after leaving the page. You may be prompted to verify
your identity with Stripe.


As an alternative to Stripe, you may contact support to be verified
within 48-72 hours.

title: No-Code Integrations
description: Not a developer? Not a problem.
content:
If you're wanting to work with the beehiiv API to integrate your publications with other software but don't have the time or resources to build an integration yourself, there's a few options available to you.
The beehiiv team currently maintains a Zapier integration and a Make integration. Both offer a no-code way to integrate your publication with other software.

title: Zapier
content:
Zapier is a platform that allows you to connect your publication to other software without having to write any code. You can use Zapier to receive real-time notifications when certain events occur on your publication, such as when a new subscriber signs up, or to make changes to your publication, such as adding a new subscriber from another service.
To get started, you'll need to sign up for an account, create a new "Zap", and search for "beehiiv" in the list of apps to connect to.
Triggers are how Zapier refers to webhooks. When you create a new Zap, you'll be able to select the type of event you want to trigger your Zap. Actions are how Zapier refers to the API calls that you want to make to the beehiiv API. Both follow similar patterns to the webhooks and API reference found elsewhere in this documentation, but are tailored to Zapier's UI and capabilities.
For more information on how to use Zapier, check out their documentation.

title: Make
content:
Make is another platform that allows you to connect your publication to other software without having to write any code. You can also use Make to receive real-time notifications when certain events occur on your publication, such as when a new subscriber signs up, or to make changes to your publication, such as adding a new subscriber from another service.
To get started, you'll need to sign up for an account, create a new "Scenario", and search for "beehiiv" in the list of apps to connect to.
To use webhooks with Make, please refer to our webhooks documentation for more information. For other actions, Make provides a UI for you to interact with the beehiiv API in a similar fashion to the API reference.
Compared to Zapier, Make offers additional functionality, such as easy-to-use functions for formatting and manipulating data in between steps.
For more information on how to use Make, check out their documentation.


The beehiiv support team only services Make and Zapier for no-code integrations. If you're using other no-code
platforms, we may not be able to provide direct support for your integration.

title: Webhooks
description: An easy way to receive real-time notifications when certain events occur on your beehiiv publication.
content:
Webhooks are currently only available for paid users on the Scale plan and above. To upgrade your account, click
here.

title: Why use webhooks
content:
Webhooks are a way to receive real-time notifications when certain events occur on your beehiiv publication. These can be helpful for:
Integrating your publication with other services.

Keeping track of your audience in third-party apps.

And more.

title: How to configure webhooks
content:
Webhooks can be configured in two ways:
In the app: Navigate to Settings > Integrations > Webhooks.

Using the API: Send a POST request to the /webhooks endpoint (see API reference).


The event types are listed in the sidebar of this page and are organized by the resource they are associated with.

title: Webhooks in Zapier and Make
content:
The beehiiv team currently maintain a Zapier integration and a Make integration.
In Zapier, webhooks are known as "Triggers," which assist the user set up a webhook without having to set them up in the app as outlined above. In Make, users should use the Custom Webhook module and follow step 1 above to set up their webhook to point to the Make-provided URL.

title: Add subscription to an automation
description:
Add an existing subscription to an automation flow. Requires the automation to have an active Add by API trigger. The specified email or subscription_id will be matched against your existing subscribers. If an existing subscriber is found, they will be enrolled immediately.




Looking to enroll new subscribers? Use the Create Subscription endpoint instead and specify the automation_ids param.

title: List automation journeys
description: Retrieve a list of automation journeys that have occurred within a specific automation.

title: Get automation journey
description: Retrieve a single automation journey by ID.

title: List subscription updates
description: Returns a list of Subscription Update objects for a publication.

title: Get subscription update
description: Returns a single Subscription Update object for a publication.

title: Update subscriptions
description: Bulk update multiple subscriptions fields, including status, custom fields, and tiers.

title: Update subscriptions
description: Bulk update multiple subscriptions fields, including status, custom fields, and tiers.

title: Update subscriptions' status
description: Bulk update subscriptions' status.

title: Update subscriptions' status
description: Bulk update subscriptions' status.

title: Create custom field
description: Create a custom field on a publication, for use in subscriptions

title: Get custom field
description: View a specific custom field on a publication

title: List custom fields
description: List all custom fields on a publication

title: Update custom field
description: Update a custom field on a publication

title: Update custom field
description: Update a custom field on a publication

title: Delete custom field
description: Delete a custom field from a publication

title: List posts
description: Retrieve all posts belonging to a specific publication

title: Get post
description: Retreive a single Post belonging to a specific publication

title: Delete post
description: Delete or Archive a post. Any post that has been confirmed will have it's status changed to archived. Posts in the draft status will be permenantly deleted.

title: List publications
description: Retrieve all publications associated with your API key.

title: Get publication
description: Retrieve a single publication

title: Get referral program
description: Retrieve details about the publication's referral program, including milestones and rewards.

title: List segments
description: Retrieve information about all segments belonging to a specific publication

title: Get segment
description: Retrieve information about a specific segment belonging to a publication

title: List segment subscribers
description: List the Subscriber Ids from the most recent calculation of a specific publication.

title: Delete segment
description: Delete a segment. Deleting the segment does not effect the subscriptions in the segment.

title: Create subscription
description: Create new subscriptions for a publication.

title: List subscriptions
description: Retrieve all subscriptions belonging to a specific publication

title: Get subscription by email
description: Please note that this endpoint requires the email to be URL encoded. Please reference your language's documentation for the correct method of encoding. Retrieve a single subscription belonging to a specific email address in a specific publication.

title: Get subscription by ID
description: In previous versions of the API, another endpoint existed to retrieve a subscription by the subscriber ID. This endpoint is now deprecated and will be removed in a future version of the API. Please use this endpoint instead. The subscription ID can be found by exporting a list of subscriptions either via the Settings > Publications > Export Data or by exporting a CSV in a segment. Retrieve a single subscription belonging to a specific publication.

title: Update subscription
description: Update a single subscription.

title: Update subscription
description: Update a single subscription.

title: Delete subscription
description:
This cannot be undone. All data associated with the subscription will also be deleted. We recommend unsubscribing when possible instead of deleting.



If a premium subscription is deleted they will no longer be billed. Deletes a subscription.

title: Add subscription tag
description: Adds tags to a subscription. If the tag does not exist on the publication, it will be created automatically.

title: Create a tier
description: Create a new tier for a publication.

title: List tiers
description: Retrieve all tiers belonging to a specific publication

title: Get tier
description: Retrieve a single tier belonging to a specific publication

title: Update a tier
description: Update an existing tier belonging to a specific publication

title: Update a tier
description: Update an existing tier belonging to a specific publication

title: Create a webhook
description: Create a new webhook for a given publication.

title: List webhooks
description: Retrieve all webhooks belonging to a specific publication.

title: Get webhook
description: Retrieve a specific webhook belonging to a publication.

title: Delete a webhook
description: Delete a webhook subscription from a publication.
